snippet: Despite the immigrant Ghanaian population’s rise in New York, the new regional chief must fight to preserve Ashanti cultural traditions.
abstract: Nana Acheampong-Tieku of the Bronx is sworn in as New York regional chief of the Ashanti people from Ghana, West Africa; fight to preserve Ashanti cultural traditions is increasingly difficult in the face of a plummeting membership in the Asanteman Association of USA despite a growth of the Ghanaian population in the New York area.
lead_paragraph: Despite the immigrant Ghanaian population’s rise in New York, the new regional chief must fight to preserve Ashanti cultural traditions.

headline.seo: Ashanti Group From Ghana Installs Its New York Chief
headline.main: With Fanfare, Ashanti People From Ghana Install Their New York Chief
headline.print_headline: With Fanfare, Ashanti People From Ghana Install Their New York Chief
